Posts.Content: MaxK wrote: I just wanted to say how wonderfully supportive everyone on this board is.  I have been waiting "patiently" for 4 weeks for my followup spot compression mammogram and u/s (one week left!!).  I come here often just to read the posts and find the time everyone takes to answer peoples questions and give kind words of encouragement is amazing.  I have my additional tests scheduled for next Tuesday.  Since I've had to wait 5 weeks to get into an appt, I've determined that if everything is okay with this round of testing (positive thoughts) that I think next year I will either move up or back my annual appt....  I tell you, waiting thru Breast Cancer awareness month is not fun!  I swear every place I go there is a constant reminder that I am "in waiting"!  The funniest was when I was at my post op appt the other day with my general surgeon (I had minor leg surgery)...  his normal rooms were full so they had me wait in the "Breast Surgeons" room...  I figured I can't win!!  Anyway, thanks for letting me voice my thoughts.  I'll check in next week after my appt.  I hope its okay for me to be a little light hearted...  I swear I've gained 7-8 pounds the last month from the stress/anxiety...  I have to find humor in it sometimes! Lynn   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just saying thanks... MaxK Shirlann

Posts.Content: MaxK wrote: I guess I'm just curious.  I had a screening mammogram done on Sept 21st and got a call back on Sept 25th with news of an abnormal mammogram.  I called the place recommended by my doctor (where they sent my results) and I can't get in until Oct 30th.  Years ago when I found a mass myself, I don't remember having to wait nearly that long to get in for the diagnostic mammogram - is this normal?   I've already called the place again at the recommendation of my doctor to see if they can move me up, but they are "booked"....  but offered to send my things over to the mammogram dept and they would call me if they have an opening (not holding my breath).  Normally I wouldn't be that worried about it, but since I felt something in the same place before my mammogram originally, I guess I'm more emotional about it than normal. Okay, I just needed to get this off my mind and see if I am totally crazy....  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How long did you have to wait? MaxK lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2007 07:40AM MaxK wrote: Thank you so much for your responses.  I have more to write, but can't at the moment (at work), but just wanted to let you know I appreciate the feedback!
Posts.Title: How long did you have to wait? MaxK lvtwoqlt
